item.title: Brain Overflow
item.description: Brain (Buffer) Overflow What happens if you try to access some “extra” part of computer memory? What is memory? What could go wrong if our program doesn’t check for boundaries? Well, that’s what we’ll be seing in this post. Buffers According with our good old friend Wikipedia, buffers can be described as a region of a memory used to temporarily store data while it is being moved from one place to another.
